programme.title: Kevin Hart: Standing Tall
programme.desc: Laughter is the best medicine. Just ask Kevin Hart. Comedy would rule as an antidote to a troubled childhood. Hart’s work ethic has no limits, with 8 comedy specials, 54 films, 90 TV shows, and a world tour to date.

programme.title: The Perfect Mate
programme.desc: When Hope's relationship crumbles, she seeks a Christian man to meet her family's expectations. Jesse steps up, but it's challenging.

programme.title: The 5th King- Iran "The Blade" Barkley Story
programme.desc: The rise, the fall, and the rise again of Iran "The Blade" Barkley, from poverty in the South Bronx to undisputable boxing glory.

programme.title: My Name Is Peaches: A Film About Womanism
programme.desc: My Name Is Peaches' is a compelling documentary that delves into the heart of womanism. It explores the experiences, challenges, and triumphs of African American women who have paved the way for a more equitable world.

programme.title: Becoming Barack: Finding Hope
programme.desc: The untold story of Barack Obama, from his early pre-political years in community building to becoming the 44th President of the United States.

programme.title: Partners of the Heart
programme.desc: Against the backdrop of segregation, Vivien Thomas, a black carpenter with a genius for surgery, and Dr. Alfred Blalock, a renowned white surgeon, dared to defy medical gospel by forging a partnership that changed the course of medical history.

programme.title: Happiness Is a Four Letter Word
programme.desc: A heart-warming romance that explores the lives of three best friends – Nandi, Zaza, and Princess - living the good life in the vibrant city of Johannesburg.

programme.title: Breaking Three Hours: Trailblazing African American Women Marathoners
programme.desc: Out of 14 million marathon finishers, only 20 were US-born, African American women finishing under three hours. This documentary follows nine of these remarkable women, Hall of Fame runners.

programme.title: Becoming Barack: Finding Hope
programme.desc: The untold story of Barack Obama, from his early pre-political years in community building to becoming the 44th President of the United States.

programme.desc: Against the backdrop of segregation, Vivien Thomas, a black carpenter with a genius for surgery, and Dr. Alfred Blalock, a renowned white surgeon, dared to defy medical gospel by forging a partnership that changed the course of medical history.

programme.desc: My Name Is Peaches' is a compelling documentary that delves into the heart of womanism. It explores the experiences, challenges, and triumphs of African American women who have paved the way for a more equitable world.

programme.title: Look Away, Look Away
programme.desc: After a racist murders nine black churchgoers in South Carolina, this award-winning film follows the fierce battle in Mississippi to determine the fate of the state flag with the most powerful and divisive symbol of the Confederacy.

programme.title: Breaking Three Hours: Trailblazing African American Women Marathoners
programme.desc: Out of 14 million marathon finishers, only 20 were US-born, African American women finishing under three hours. This documentary follows nine of these remarkable women, Hall of Fame runners.

programme.title: Ben and Ara
programme.desc: Ara, a brilliant Muslim woman, is head over heels in love with Ben, an agnostic. Can they unite their families despite their cultural differences?

programme.title: Happiness Is a Four Letter Word
programme.desc: A heart-warming romance that explores the lives of three best friends – Nandi, Zaza, and Princess - living the good life in the vibrant city of Johannesburg.

programme.title: Southeast 67
programme.desc: Spanning 20 years, Southeast 67 follows a group of African American students from Washington, D.C. who were promised college scholarships in 1988 at the age of twelve, yet struggled with survival in a neighborhood devastated by the crack epidemic
